attributes.content: Ah.
Forgive my presumption. Might you be the Doctor?
I never thought you’d remember me.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Have we met somewhere before? Or, perhaps, you've previously read my files?
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Ah, my apologies. Could this be the first time we've met? I still haven't introduced myself.
Hello, Doctor. Call me 12F, let's say. Since I'm no more than an ordinary Detachment Operator, I've had relatively few chances to have met with you face-to-face.

attributes.options: Don't be so polite!;......;You don't need to be so reserved.

attributes.content: Nay. Once you're familiar with me, you may well come to hate me.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: With some politeness, both sides are left a little leeway. Leeway to advance a step, or to withdraw something.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: I'd heard the Doctor was a reticent one. I won't be asking you to say anything further.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Your experiences and mine are probably nothing alike, and our dispositions are assuredly a gulf apart.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: When going outside, I do tend to be somewhat polite. Once used to speaking like this, it's hard to change.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: I've seen no shortage of rude remarks come to a fight, after all. By and large, we keep at a distance from vulgar people, without any another reason—only that one thing less, perhaps, beats one thing more.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: It's truly been a long campaign... and you've endured to the bitter end.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Battles like these are only cause to feel fear. Might you feel that way, Doctor?
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.options: (In turn, ask him whether he's afraid.);(As ever, be silent.);(Painstakingly, explain to him how you're already used to this.)

attributes.content: If you were to ask...
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: I don't tell lies. I am. Granted, I've already come all this way with the team, but I'm still quite afraid.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: In the wilderness, dying is not much worth mentioning, a trivial thing. This has become a consensus across near to all people.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: I believe that was why we set up nomadic cities. We wished to live on, to not be killed by the wilderness again.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: But the disasters occurring among these cities were a repeated reminder to us that often, when we think we've had the great fortune to escape from somewhere, we'll play new misfortunes upon ourselves.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Did the people of Chernobog ever imagine they'd go through this? I imagine they didn't. It's no good thing, passing your days trembling in fear.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Outcomes such as this are too dark. I can't imagine what I'd be like, stuck to this vision and living on.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: But all of this has dropped, unwittingly, right on their heads. We've stopped the Core City. What if something broke out once again within Chernobog?
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: When I consider all we might encounter in future, it leaves me feeling only afraid.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Given you're unwilling to say much, Doctor, I won't ask much more.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: What is it you're used to?
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Are you used to fear, or... used to fighting?
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: I'm somewhat saddened.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Please, be reassured, I'm not prejudiced against you...
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: I suppose you should mean the latter.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: To be used to fighting... many soldiers have said similar things.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: You aren't a soldier, yet you're used to risking life and limb alongside them. You ought to have something you pursue in battle, then?
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Or alternatively, in your eyes, this conflict is only a means to an end... or perhaps, the blood and glory in every battle makes you feel... excitement?
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Doctor, I'm sorry. I seem to have gone somewhat too far.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Only, I myself hope greatly that you're able to leave the theater of war, Doctor. Perhaps you, in your capacity as a battlefield commander, can stand level against even Dr. Kal'tsit—
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: But just like Dr. Kal'tsit, I believe if you threw even greater energy into your original field of study, your original life, you would bring about even more benefit to others.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: But things often turn out contrary to how you wish. Innocent children pick up weapons, people who brimmed with vigor lose their lives, and families who live life happily shatter apart. We cannot prevent it.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: As for being used to being afraid, I believe that refers much more to people like me.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: I'm hard-pressed to feel that you and I are the same type, Doctor. Ever since you arose, all these battles you've taken part in, I consider you to have fundamentally won.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Are you possibly afraid of winning? Or are you possibly afraid that if you were unable to achieve victory, you'd lose something?
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: But I'm not fond of battles at all. If I were allowed, I'd run far, far away.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Perhaps, just maybe, I'm the complete contrary to you. Because I might even be afraid of victory.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.options: (Maintain silence.);(Inquire what his purpose for asking is.)

attributes.content: It's getting late. My team should be prepared to retreat by now.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Please take care of yourself. I wish you a pleasant day.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Because I wanted to understand your character. Though, given I could find you here, I can more or less arrive at my own answer.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Disregarding the people who already knew you well, there are plenty like myself who didn't join Rhodes Island too long ago, who feel some sense of curiosity about you.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Of Amiya, we all have the same general impression. Everyone knows that beneath her miniscule stature lies a tenacious will, holding her up...
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Opinions on Dr. Kal'tsit all vary, while I can very much understand her. No matter what Dr. Kal'tsit does, she always has a basis. She's in no way impetuous, and never acts on an impulse.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: That's simply not something the average person can achieve.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Whereas you...
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: What about you?
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: It's not been too long since you came back to Rhodes Island, and before you'd returned, your name had spread fast.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: But we didn't know who you were. What kind of person were you? What would you bring for us?
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Before you came, Dr. Kal'tsit pushed the notification to each individual's terminal, letting us all know that you'd be an important member of the Rhodes Island Command Department someday.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Though plenty of notifications from HR are similar, I was still able to pick up on the information concealed within that short paragraph of text—
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: —You were, to some of us, completely unfamiliar. At the time, at least, that was how it was.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: ...It's not just that we don't know what sort of past you had. We weren't even sure of what kind of future you had.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Where would Rhodes Island lead us? Along the way, you'd be sure to play an important role. I know that was how a lot of people felt.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: But what about you yourself? Might you feel like all of that... is not part of you? You've lost your memories, after all, and this world hides a great many facts from you.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Doctor, I have some personal experience. Can you hear it out? You may as well, really; you don't have to take it seriously.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: You might feel like, ever since you've woken, you haven't had much right to choose anything, that the road has been paved out entirely by others.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Personally, in my experience, from the moment I was born up 'til now, ever since I was tossed into this land, I've always had that sort of a feeling. That I can't choose. I can only live upon this great land.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Putting those great figures who've felt they could change their own fate aside, we ordinary people... please, just allow me to say this! We ordinary people are always pushed along.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: But are we truly allowed no choice?
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: To this Chernobog core city mission, I signed up.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: I knew this was highly dangerous, and I knew it went against what I believed... more than doing anything to shake the world, what I want is to live on.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: And I was very well aware I couldn't help with much myself. Compared to other, far more specialized Operators, it was all I could do not to get in the way.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: But I still chose to do things in this manner. I didn't need to explain to anyone else my reasons, nor did I need to tangle myself in anything after this.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Before we made our decisions, we wondered why we had to do things this way. And after that, so we did them.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: So, Doctor, you actually had some sort of choice, didn't you?
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: You came with us all the way here.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: You're here.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: ...That's my verdict, then.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Thank you for your time, Doctor. I apologize for talking to myself for so long. But I do understand you a little more now.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: —It's getting late. Preparations for work should be more or less there by now. I've confirmed your safety as well. Following that, our team should be retreating.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: So I'll see you at Rhodes, Doctor.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: Oh, right, Doctor...
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: No matter if it's just in the moment, or just the slightest variance. The future will surely follow with each difference in your choices, and expose a different appearance as time goes by.
attributes.name: 12F

attributes.content: I trust you will always have a choice.
attributes.name: 12F
